page.title: 05CULMSTOCK FLORA - ON COMMONS
page.content: On MAIDENDOWN and BLACKDOWN COMMON, in late Spring and eary Summer, marsh and heath orchids are to be found and the charming but elusive little pink butterwort. Later, the vivid golden-orange bog asphodel and the pretty pink and silvery cross-leaved heath show up, while on THE BEACON itself bell-heather and ling grow freely - also dodder, blue and pink milkwort and the round and long-leaved sundew. Earlier, the rippling purple moor grass is much in evidence with a variety of ferns including the hard fern, while the dwarf or summer gorse is abundant later in the year. From January on, almost any part of the the Parish will reveal, in due course, snowdrops, primroses, wood violets, kingcups, early purple orchids, lady's smock, cow parsley and a host of others.
